citation.article-title: Ruania albidiflava gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel member of the suborder Micrococcineae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Ruania (Ru.an′i.a. N.L. fem. n. Ruania named after Ji-Sheng Ruan, a Chinese microbiologist who has made great contributions to the development of actinomycete taxonomy in China).
Gram-positive, aerobic, mesophilic, moderately halotolerant, non-acid-fast, non-motile, non-spore-forming cocci.
The rod–coccus life cycle is not detected.
The peptidoglycan type is A4α with an l-lys-gly–l-glu–l-Glu interpeptide bridge.
The main fatty acid is anteiso-C15 : 0 (12-methyl tetradecanoic acid).
The major polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol and one unknown glycolipid.
The 16S rRNA gene sequence signature nucleotides are listed in Table 1.
The genus belongs phylogenetically to the suborder Micrococcineae, order Actinomycetales.
The type species is Ruania albidiflava.
